WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY
MORGANTOWN, WEST VIRGINIA
OFFICE OF RADIO, TELEVISION, AND MOTION PICTURES
STATION WWVU-TV, CHANNEL 24
July 3, 1968
Mr. Ken Clark, Project Director
Educational Television Stations
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Mr. Clark:
I was pleased to learn of the NAEB project you are now directing
and wish you well.
WWVU-TV will not be on-the-air until "December but has been active
for a number of years in motion picture production. We have done no
programs on the ghetto but I thought you might want to know of an award
winning film we produced in 1963. A 16mm color film, SPRING COMES TO
VINTROUX, documents the actions taken by citizens of a small community
near Charleston which — with the help of the WVU Cooperative Extension
Service — worked together for the betterment of a community which had
not kept abreast of, the times. Narrated by Frank Blair of NBC News the
program won two first-place awards in national competitions. It has been
distributed by EEN and I feel has a positive timely message regarding
community team work.
I will'keep you appraised of any future production efforts which
might relate to your project.
Programming Operations Manager
